hackathon-description-text: AtomHacks is Bronx Science’s annual Hackathon! Requested by students and supported by alumni in a diverse range of companies and industries, AtomHacks is designed to help students practice their coding skills, formulate their ideas, collaborate together, problem-solve and create something awesome.
hackathon-eligibility: You must be a current Bronx Science student to attend.
hackathon-requirements: Anything you can set your mind to!
hackathon-rules: All code must be written by members of your team during the time of AtomHacks. Any hacks that are offensive or violent will hurt the status of your hack.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: All first place members will receive a 3D printer!
Chipotle GIft Cards given out to all second place winners!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=75 W 205th St, Bronx, NY 10468, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How unique is the idea or concept? Does it take a new perspective on an old problem or present a new idea?
Does the hack work? Is it well designed? How is the user experience? Does it demonstrate a knowledge or understanding of the computer programming language used?
Who is the target audience for this hack? Does it help solve a problem or challenge that the target audience experiences?

hackathon-location-description: The Bronx High School of Science
